raw: * The axis maps virtual screen coordinates to item indexes. By default all
* items have the same size but it is also possible to give specific items
* a different size.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The axis maps virtual screen coordinates to item indexes. By default all items have the same size but it is also possible to give specific items a different size.

raw: * Every change to the axis configuration triggers this event.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Every change to the axis configuration triggers this event.

raw: * Get the default size of the items.
* @return {Integer} The default item size.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Get the default size of the items.

raw: * Set the default size the items.
* @param defaultItemSize {Integer} The default size of the items.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: defaultItemSize {Integer} The default size of the items.
@param.description: The default size of the items.

raw: * Get the number of items in the axis.
* @return {Integer} The number of items.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Get the number of items in the axis.

raw: * Set the number of items in the axis.
* @param itemCount {Integer} The new item count.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Set the number of items in the axis.

raw: * Sets the size of a specific item. This allow item, which have a size
* different from the default size.
* @param index {Integer} Index of the item to change.
* @param size {Integer} New size of the item.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the size of a specific item. This allow item, which have a size different from the default size.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: index {Integer} Index of the item to change.
@param.description: Index of the item to change.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: size {Integer} New size of the item.

raw: * Get the size of the item at the given index.
* @param index {Integer} Index of the item to get the size for.
* @return {Integer} Size of the item.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Get the size of the item at the given index.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: index {Integer} Index of the item to get the size for.
@param.description: Index of the item to get the size for.

raw: * Reset all custom sizes set with {@link #setItemSize}.
* Split the position range into disjunct intervals. Each interval starts
* with a custom sized cell. Each position is contained in exactly one range.
* The ranges are sorted according to their start position.
* Complexity: O(n log n) (n = number of custom sized cells)
* @return {Map[]} The sorted list of ranges.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Split the position range into disjunct intervals. Each interval starts with a custom sized cell. Each position is contained in exactly one range. The ranges are sorted according to their start position. Complexity: O(n log n) (n = number of custom sized cells)

raw: * Returns the range, which contains the position
* Complexity: O(log n) (n = number of custom sized cells)
* @param position {Integer} The position.
* @return {Map} The range, which contains the given position.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the range, which contains the position Complexity: O(log n) (n = number of custom sized cells)

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Map} The range, which contains the given position.
@return.description: The range, which contains the given position.

raw: * Get the item and the offset into the item at the given position.
* @param position {Integer|null} The position to get the item for.
* @return {Map} A map with the keys index and
* offset. The index is the index of the item containing the
*    position and offsets specifies offset into this item. If the position
* is outside of the range, null is returned.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Get the item and the offset into the item at the given position.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: position {Integer|null} The position to get the item for.
@param.description: The position to get the item for.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Map} A map with the keys index and offset. The index is the index of the item containing the position and offsets specifies offset into this item. If the position is outside of the range, null is returned.
@return.description: A map with the keys index and offset. The index is the index of the item containing the position and offsets specifies offset into this item. If the position is outside of the range, null is returned.

raw: * Returns the range, which contains the position.
* Complexity: O(log n) (n = number of custom sized cells)
* @param index {Integer} The index of the item to get the range for.
* @return {Map} The range for the index.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the range, which contains the position. Complexity: O(log n) (n = number of custom sized cells)

@param.name: @param
@param.body: index {Integer} The index of the item to get the range for.
@param.description: The index of the item to get the range for.

raw: * Get the start position of the item with the given index.
* @param index {Integer} The item's index.
* @return {Integer|null} The start position of the item. If the index is outside
* of the axis range null is returned.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Get the start position of the item with the given index.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Integer|null} The start position of the item. If the index is outside of the axis range null is returned.
@return.description: The start position of the item. If the index is outside of the axis range null is returned.

raw: * Returns the sum of all cell sizes.
* @return {Integer} The sum of all item sizes.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the sum of all cell sizes.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Integer} The sum of all item sizes.
@return.description: The sum of all item sizes.

raw: * Get an array of item sizes starting with the item at "startIndex". The
* sum of all sizes in the returned array is at least "minSizeSum".
* @param startIndex {Integer} The index of the first item.
* @param minSizeSum {Integer} The minimum sum of the item sizes.
* @return {Integer[]} List of item sizes starting with the size of the item
* at index startIndex. The sum of the item sizes is at least
* minSizeSum.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Get an array of item sizes starting with the item at "startIndex". The sum of all sizes in the returned array is at least "minSizeSum".

@param.name: @param
@param.body: startIndex {Integer} The index of the first item.
@param.description: The index of the first item.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: minSizeSum {Integer} The minimum sum of the item sizes.
@param.description: The minimum sum of the item sizes.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Integer[]} List of item sizes starting with the size of the item at index startIndex. The sum of the item sizes is at least minSizeSum.
@return.description: List of item sizes starting with the size of the item at index startIndex. The sum of the item sizes is at least minSizeSum.
